channel.title: Problem Getting my Server online
channel.description:
Iv gone through all the steps in the guides and still its offline I think my problem is when i run.bat i get Starting Pimpscape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594 im not sure if this is usually my guess would be i need my ip in the 0.0.0.0 spot but cant find how to do this if this is not the problem pleas ehelp i got my no-ip running iv compiled a forwarded the port and everything i got my firewall off and the Newest Version of Java still nothing... am i missing something iv followed the guide on here closely
Ty in Advance

item.title: Problem Getting my Server online
item.dc:creator: @krupe krupe
item.description:
@krupe wrote:

ty for the help i think my problem is when i made my no-ip i didnt use my default gateway but the ip of my comp found at whatsmyip

acually according to the guides im spose to use the ip in the upper left but im not really sure on waht you saying camran

and fury iv done all of those :\

and ipconfig does not work for me i getthat its not reconized but if im correct mine is 192.168.1.1 im on a westell and that gets me to my router options

lol here ill edit again i went into my router and i went to find the ports to make sure i entered correctly when i ran into “enable service” and i clicked that and now when i check my server status it said online witch is new but i still cant login[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2008, 08:48:40 AM[/size][hr]BUMP?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2008, 09:51:38 AM[/size][hr]sorry for tripple post… but i keeps getting pushed way down

Read full topic

item.title: Problem Getting my Server online
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

To make sure what you called “done all the steps” is what I’m thinking, I will ask what you’ve done.

-Gotten a no-ip?
–Is so, gotten the box checked and updated?
-Opened a port in you firewall?
–If so, did you use the default port 43594 and set it as a TCP?
-Portforwaded (If you have a wireless router which allows a network and have multiple computers connected)
–If so, how did you port forward?
-Set your server to the default port? (43595) Accessed at server.java

Think that’s it… Any of those that you didn’t do? If you did then obviously you did something wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem Getting my Server online
item.dc:creator: @Camranrev Camranrev
item.description:
@Camranrev wrote:

Hey look its supposed to be 0,0,0,0 let me help u here on nop ip make your ip your REAL ip and in your router make the forward ip to 192.168.1.100 if that is your defualt gateway…
Hope i helped

PS you can find out defualt gateway by clicking run in start menu then cmd then typing in ipconfig you shall see defualt gateway…

Read full topic
